block.p: Kimber Leigh Wilson and Matthew Kemp Blackburn, both patent lawyers with Morgan & Finnegan, a New York law firm, were married yesterday. The Rev. Catherine A. Caimano, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Holy Trinity in New York.

Mrs. Blackburn, 32, graduated from the University of Arizona at Tucson, where she also received a master's degree in analytical chemistry. She earned a law degree from George Washington University. She is the daughter of Sandra and Joseph Wilson of Tubac, Ariz. Her father is an independent consultant on water treatment and hydrometallurgy to the mining industry.

Kimber Leigh Wilson and Matthew Kemp Blackburn, both patent lawyers with Morgan & Finnegan, a New York law firm, were married yesterday. The Rev. Catherine A. Caimano, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Holy Trinity in New York.

Mrs. Blackburn, 32, graduated from the University of Arizona at Tucson, where she also received a master's degree in analytical chemistry. She earned a law degree from George Washington University. She is the daughter of Sandra and Joseph Wilson of Tubac, Ariz. Her father is an independent consultant on water treatment and hydrometallurgy to the mining industry.

The bridegroom, 28, graduated from the Stevens Institute of Technology and the Georgetown University Law Center. He is the son of Joyce and Douglas Blackburn of Monrovia, Md. His father owns R. A. Blackburn Equipment Corporation, a family business in Kensington, Md., which distributes lawn and landscaping equipment.
